article_title: Court orders state to give Medi-Cal benefits within 45 days
article_text: An Alameda court has ruled that California must give Medi-Cal applicants provisional benefits within 45 days. A Visalia mother who says her son died before he got his Medi-Cal benefits led the charge to change the state’s practices.

article_metadata.title: Court orders state to give Medi-Cal benefits within 45 days | Fresno Bee

article_summary:
An Alameda court has ruled that California must give Medi-Cal applicants provisional benefits within 45 days.
A Visalia mother who says her son died before he got his Medi-Cal benefits led the charge to change the state’s practices.
